intro: Jaborosa andina, commonly known as the Andean jaborosa, is a flowering plant native to the high Andes of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky, high-altitude environments, where it thrives in cool and temperate conditions. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, while its flowers are small and clustered in inflorescences. Jaborosa andina is also valued for its traditional medicinal uses among local communities.
